intro: Euphrasia mucronulata, commonly known as the blunt-tipped eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and somewhat hairy. Euphrasia mucronulata is often found in calcareous soils and is known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
